Am besten zusammen mit ein paar Kumpels spielen. Taktik Absprache fÃ¼r bestimmte Maps via TS3 oder Skype sind sehr von Vorteil.

This was good, waiting so bad for the second
Excellent game! Definitely worth every cent!

killing foor is a survival action horror first person shooting game in which you have to kill waves of poorly animated zombie creatures until the slutty shop keeper comes onto you over the radio and you can beg for money from your teammates.
Fun when you play with some friends and get some good weaps.
Yes.

I'm only 5 hours into the game and I'm ADDICTED to this game already. Think of it as Left 4 Dead's survival mode, only gloomly and dark and sadistic. Variety of infected to take on, like clots, fleshpounds, bloaters, etc. The Fleshpounds make the Tank look like a wimp.  TONS of weapons ranging from machetes, M4s, lever-actions, .44s, the whole nine yards and much more badass weaponry. Great music to listen to while knocking down hordes of zombies. Plenty of maps to play on. The multiplayer is alive and active. Overall, awesome game.

Creo que "adictivo" no empieza a describir lo que pienso de Ã©ste juego, llevo pocas horas en Ã©l pero espero pasar muchas, muchas mÃ¡s, un buen gameplay que toma mucho prestado de el gran Left4Dead, pero que le agrega lo suficiente para sentirse como un producto aparte, Aunque pienso que le falta ese sentido de Co-op puro que solo L4D logra, lo compensa con un sistema de progresiÃ³n bien pensado y que funciona de maravilla, y con un gameplay mÃ¡s que recompensante.

Si te gustan los Co-Op, y encima de zombies, Â¿a quÃ© esperas para comprarlo?
Yas

Great game, can't wait for Living Ceiling 2. Mods are cool, especially the ones that allow for 30 people and really op Fleshpounds with millions of hp. Great content from the workshop despite being such an old game. Good zombie killing game, great for playing with friends. No sprint button bothers me a bit though.

A fun game to play with freinds 8/10

After 300+ hours, I am still finding enjoyment in this first person survival horror title. Effort and working with certain weapons grants permanent bonuses to players both offline and online. I strongly reccomend this title to anyone who has played similar titles, and hope to see you on the Killing Floor!
very good

Great Zombie shooter I bought this before I had bought  Left 4 dead 2 and then I unfortunatly bought left 4  dead 2 I was sad to see the state of left 4 dead 2 and have never played it since I do play Killing floor often since it has a perk system and the ability to Aim down your sites and greatly increase accuracy is invaluable on the sometimes very large maps. A wide variety of difficulty settings incase you get bored in your solo play on begginer or normal you can take it up a notch and see if you can do better, a multiplayer setting with a lot of great fun.

This is probably the biggest disgrace to FPS games of all time. Let's see, this game has no destructible environment. If you throw a grenade at a wall, the wall does not collapse, WTF?! ARE YOU SERIOUS?! Look at Battlefield 4, that game has falling skyscrapers! Second, this game is too unrealistic. I mean, seriously, man-eating mutants? Wow, that's sooooooo realistic... NOT! Third, how does the enemy in the 11th round talk? Mutants cannot talk! They are NOT humans! Fourth, the game is obviously using an old, crappy engine. Have you guys seen Battlefield Hardline's Frostbite 4 engine? It looks FANTASTIC! Last but not least, this game is waaaaay too boring. The maps are puny. No wonder why this game has no vehicles like tanks or jets. Look at Battlefield 4, that game has GIGANTIC maps and the game is EXTREMELY fast paced and NOT slow paced as s**t at all! 

I highly do NOT recommend this game, but I do highly recommend Battlefield 4, a true military simulator.

Fun with friends

While generally, Killing Floor receives an overall average score, it is actually unjustified without truly embracing what the developers desired.

The moment you play Killing Floor, you find yourself easily swarmed, easily surrounded, easily annihilated. Why? The reason is simple. Killing Floor beyond beginner mode was geared for teamwork. There is, without a doubt, no way you can start this game and be good without a team.

Killing Floor has a unique spawning system where the zombies will always spawn local to the players. They will specifically target areas that are not covered and work to surround you relentlessly. Unless you are a professional, have around a hundred hours on your belt, a level 5 minimal (out of 6 levels) character, you will not survive solo.

To break it down, the classes are divided into Field Medic, Support Specialist, Sharpshooter, Commando, Berserker, Firebug and Demolition.

Those who love to play support roles, Field Medic and obviously Support Specialist are for you. You will either heal your allies while killing what they can't, or wielding doors shut strategically as the Support Specialist.

Sharpshooters and Commando have their own specialized targets. These two make a good pair in taking out the strongest zombies together. What a Sharpshooter sniper cannot kill in a single blow, you can count on the Commando to finish off with their ability to see invisible targets and the zombie health bars.

In addition, Support Specialist is also the shotgun spray king. Along with Firebug that causes damage over time, and the destructive Demolition's firepower, you will have the perfect selection of crowd controllers who take out all the weak ones as the second line of defense.

As for your first line, who else can do a better job than the Berserker? Well... except for the unexpected tank, the Field Medic. While the Berserker is an excellent melee unit that cannot be pinned down easily, the medic, when armored, can resist death from even the boss for a good 10-15 seconds head on while your ally may be mowed down in a second.

Killing Floor still does seasonal events, gives special unlocks, and continually adds new maps and game modes. You will not be disappointed.

Be warned, Killing Floor is not a game to be played alone. Personally, I highly recommend a team of at least 4 individuals. By mid levels, you can go with 3. Later on, you can even solo. But as a team, you can take on even the most biggest, baddest of zombies on the worst difficulties.

Can you ditch your soloing habits from the world of FPS and adapt to the teamwork requirements of Killing Floor? Or will you be the first one eaten alive...
